content.description: Really fun rock wrestling up awesome crack features and blocks.  Bring your kneepads.
content.protection: Bolts.  There may be fixed draws on this route.  If so, inspect the carabiners for your own safety.

content.description: The crag "warm-up"  Some thinner climbing down low leads to big pulls on big holds.  Very fun.
content.protection: Bolts.  This route may have fixed draws on it.  If so, inspect the condition of the carabiners for your own safety.
content.location: This is the second route from the left.

content.description: This is the furthest left route.  It traverses left.  It is not fully cleaned so climb at your own risk.
content.location: furthest left route in the cave.

content.description: Undone linkup that climbs Planking on your Girlfriend through the crux, then does a boulder problem to the right through 2 independant bolts to join Stripper Knee for its finish
content.protection: bolts.  May have fixed draws.  IF so, inspect the carabiners for your own safety.
content.location: Start on Planking, end on Stripper Knee

content.description: Starts right of Pumper Prince on white rock.  Beautiful flowstone on basalt blocks at the bottom makes for very fun climbing.  Several boulder problems lead to a puzzling and powerful crux on the steep shield .  It rejoins Pumper Prince at the top of the "shield".
content.protection: Bolts.  This route may have fixed draws.  If so, inspect the condition of the carabiners for your own safety.

content.description: The Wilson Cave is one of the steepest sport climbing "areas" in NAZ.  It hosts just a few routes, but they are unique for the area and high quality.  Steep, blocky basalt coated with a layer of limestone flowstone makes it a unique climbing experience.  It is a cave in a climber's sense, not in the classic sense of a cave that a caver would go into.  Really more of a very steep wall.
